channel.title: Bank reset dwarf remains
channel.description: I just did a total economy reset. The banks cleared but left dwarf remains in place. They are un notable and players can't rid of them. Is there like a command they can use, i can create, that'll reset their bank? i use matrix 718

item.title: Bank reset dwarf remains
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Sup22211:

Can some one explain me what is eco/economic??

Usually when someone refers to eco on here, they mean items. If the economy gets out of control, owners may reset them.

item.title: Bank reset dwarf remains
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“k0ed ur mom, post:6, topic:509343”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=627591.msg4264855#msg4264855 date=1363915768]

my eco reset code

package com.rs.tools;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;

import com.rs.utils.Utils;
import com.rs.game.item.Item;
import com.rs.game.player.content.MoneyPouch;
import com.rs.game.player.Player;
import com.rs.game.player.Skills;
import com.rs.utils.SerializableFilesManager;

public class SkillsReseter {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws ClassNotFoundException,
			IOException {
		File[] chars = new File("data/playersaves/characters").listFiles();
		for (File acc : chars) {
			try {
				Player player = (Player) SerializableFilesManager
						.loadSerializedFile(acc);
				for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
					player.getBank().removeItem(i);
				}
				for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
					player.getInventory().getItems()
							.removeAll(new Item(i, Integer.MAX_VALUE));
				}
				for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
					player.getEquipment().getItems()
							.removeAll(new Item(i, Integer.MAX_VALUE));
				}
				player.setCoins(0);
				player.reseted = 1;
				SerializableFilesManager.storeSerializableClass(player, acc);
			} catch (Throwable e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
				System.out.println("failed: " + acc.getName());
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Done.");
	}
}

Why is it 0 - 25353?
[/quote]

max item id on my server[/quote]
It shouldn’t be set to that though. Because no one is going to have that on your server. You should have it check all the slots in each bank/equipment slot… And have it remove them.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank reset dwarf remains
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“k0ed ur mom, post:4, topic:509343”]my eco reset code

[code]
package com.rs.tools;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;

import com.rs.utils.Utils;
import com.rs.game.item.Item;
import com.rs.game.player.content.MoneyPouch;
import com.rs.game.player.Player;
import com.rs.game.player.Skills;
import com.rs.utils.SerializableFilesManager;

public class SkillsReseter {

public static void main(String[] args) throws ClassNotFoundException,
		IOException {
	File[] chars = new File("data/playersaves/characters").listFiles();
	for (File acc : chars) {
		try {
			Player player = (Player) SerializableFilesManager
					.loadSerializedFile(acc);
			for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
				player.getBank().removeItem(i);
			}
			for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
				player.getInventory().getItems()
						.removeAll(new Item(i, Integer.MAX_VALUE));
			}
			for (int i = 0; i < 25353; i++) {
				player.getEquipment().getItems()
						.removeAll(new Item(i, Integer.MAX_VALUE));
			}
			player.setCoins(0);
			player.reseted = 1;
			SerializableFilesManager.storeSerializableClass(player, acc);
		} catch (Throwable e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
			System.out.println("failed: " + acc.getName());
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Done.");
}

}
[/code][/quote]
Why is it 0 - 25353?
